intro: Galium bungei var. setuliflorum, commonly known as the hairy-flowered bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its hairy texture and delicate appearance make it a distinctive species within its genus.
